name: Mini Man Burgers with Grilled Onions
headline: Mini Man Burgers with Grilled Onions
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons yellow mustard, plus more for serving
Eight 3-inch buns or rolls, split in half
8 dill pickle chips, ice cold, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the garlic powder, black pepper and 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt in a small bowl and set aside.
Combine the onions and 2 teaspoons kosher salt in a bowl and set aside for 10 minutes. Strain and reserve the juices.

Line a half sheet pan with parchment paper and place the ground chuck in the middle of the pan. Cover the meat with a large sheet of plastic wrap and roll out the meat with a small rolling pin into a large rectangle that covers the surface of the pan; it will be very thin. Remove the plastic wrap. Add a thin layer of yellow mustard and season the meat with the spice mixture.

Pick up the edge of the parchment and fold the meat in half, widthwise. Roll a couple of times just to seal the two layers. Refrigerate for 10 minutes then cut into 8 even squares with a pizza cutter.
Preheat a griddle pan over medium heat.

Spread the onions out on the griddle in an even layer in a rectangular shape. Put the patties on top of the onions. Resist the urge to press them with your spatula. Squeezing burger patties is the culinary equivalent of picking at a scab, and you remember what your mom told you about that. Pour over some of the remaining onion juice to create steam. Top each patty with a slice of cheese and the bottom half of a bun. Cover the griddle with foil (but do not seal) and reduce the heat to low. Steam the burgers until cooked, 3 to 5 minutes.

Construct burgers thusly: Add pickles and mustard to each bun top. Using a large spatula, pick up a burger-bottom bun stack and place it on the top half of a bun. Repeat with the remaining burger stacks and bun tops until there's nothing left to build.

review.reviewBody: Made these last night...unbelievably fantastic!  For burgers, we use a seasoning of equal parts of salt, pepper, garlic powder and onion powder.  Definitely use American cheese (we got from the deli, not Kraft singles).  This recipe & technique does not disappoint!

Best  mini burgers ever!!  Made several times. A few  things that worked well  for me   Grated the onions. The meat was sticking to the parchment. Instead ,I used 2 silpates, one under beef and one on top. After refrigerating I used a pizza cutter to cut burgers. Easily came  off silpat info pan.

I ‚ù§Ô∏è you Alton Brown! The depth of your food knowledge simply astounds me. I made these as written and said to myself, these are better than the original White Castle sliders, the world‚Äôs first fast food burger! The onion, mustard, pickles, steaming the meat with onion juice...it replicated the WC taste exactly; and then some! But I think I‚Äôd actually prefer King‚Äôs Hawaiian rolls for dinner rolls in this recipe. The recipe is so easy and perfect for family gatherings, tailgating, and movie üçønight. This is going to be a regular at our home.
So delicious!! Chilling the meat is key, otherwise it‚Äôs too hard to use. Definitely a keeper!

I used 80/20 ground beef, since that's what I had.¬† They were ooey gooey and good, the ones that cooked through that is.¬† It is imperative to make sure the meat is really thin,¬† Also, a little too mustardy for our tastes.¬† I think I'll be sticking to grilling or pan frying.¬†¬†
Loved this recipe! I only changed out the mustard for a bit of mayo once they were done cooking.
The flavor is good but the ground chuck makes the burgers sooo greasy. There are easier techniques that use the oven to make sliders. ¬†Not a keeper in my opinion.¬†
We had to hunt this recipe down after seeing them made on Worst Cooks. Easy and oh so yummy!
Followed Recipe to the tee. Delicious flavorful burgers. I understand the use of salt to extract moisture from onions. However Way to Salty!!!¬†
I‚Äôd show you a picture but we ate them all!   I really love Alton‚Äôs recipes.   This is the 5 th recipe out of 5 that have reallly delivered as promised

video.name: Alton's Sliders
video.description: Alton Brown shows his recruits how to make his messy, gooey, perfectly steamed sliders.
